doc:
Virginia Lee Corbin https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virginia_Lee_Corbin 0 Virginia Lee Corbin (December 5, 1910 - June 4, 1942) was an American silent film actress. Corbin began her career as a child actress in 1916, when she was billed as Baby Virginia Corbin, and went on to become a youthful flapper in the 1920s. She was one of the many silent stars that would not make it in the sound era, and retired from acting in the early 1930s.She married Chicago stockbroker Theodore Krol in 1929 and they had two children, Phillip and Robert. They divorced in 1937 and shortly after she married another Chicago stockbroker, Charles Jacobson.She died at age 31 from tuberculosis. Virginia_Lee_Corbin ( December_5_,_1910 - June_4_,_1942 ) was an_American_silent_film_actress . Corbin began her_career as a_child_actress in 1916 , when she was_billed as Baby_Virginia_Corbin , and went on to_become a_youthful_flapper in the_1920s . She was one of the_many_silent_stars that would_not_make it in the_sound_era , and retired from acting in the_early_1930s . She married Chicago_stockbroker_Theodore_Krol in 1929 and they had two_children , Phillip_and_Robert . They divorced in 1937 and shortly after she married another_Chicago_stockbroker , Charles_Jacobson.She died at age_31 from tuberculosis .
